content.content: MIP83: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters  Preamble MIP#: 83 Title: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters Author(s): @rune Contributors: @juan, @retro Tags: endgame, endgame-prelaunch-mip-set Type: Process Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-09-07 Date Ratified: 2022-10-24 Dependencies: Replaces: Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip83-recognized-launch-metadao-clusters/17709 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmTmS5Nf   Sentence Summary MIP83 is a part of the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set that configures the Clusters of the Launch MetaDAOs.  Paragraph Summary MIP83 is a part of the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set that configures the Clusters of the Launch MetaDAOs. This enables groups within the Core Units to begin preparations to restructure as MetaDAOs which is a de-risked form of scaling the Decentralized Workforce available in the Endgame.  Component Summary MIP83c1: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster Definition Defines Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters. MIP83c2: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster State Overview List of clusters, their codenames, their MetaDAO Class, and their Cluster Facilitators MIP83c3: Modify Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster state (Process Component) Defines the process for modifying the state in MIP83c2.  Motivation The Endgame Plan has been discussed in the Maker Community for more than 6 months and is now going up for a vote with the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set. The Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters MIP is a required part of the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set, and it sets up the MetaDAO Clusters to begin work immediately on preparing for the Endgame Plan Launch.  Specification / Proposal Details  MIP83c1: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster Definition A recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster is a formally recognized MetaDAO Cluster led by a Cluster Facilitator that is mandated to prepare an onboarding proposal (Cluster Proposal) to a future MetaDAO alongside their regular work in the Decentralized Workforce. The Cluster Proposal will go to a vote in the MetaDAOs own governance process after the Endgame Plan Launch has occurred and initial MetaDAO tokens have been distributed.  MIP83c2: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster State Overview This Component provides the official list of clusters with their codenames, their MetaDAO Class, and their Cluster Facilitators. The part of MIP83c2 that is modifiable by MIP83c3 begins below this line:  Crimson (Creator): TBD Vermillion (Creator): TBD Maroon (Creator): TBD Magenta (Creator): TBD Viridian (Protector): TBD Spring (Protector): TBD  The part of MIP83c2 that is modifiable by MIP83c3 ends above this line.  MIP83c3: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster Amendment Process This process component establishes the process to overwrite the state of the modifiable part of MIP83c2, making it possible to change the number of Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters, their names, their class, and their Cluster Facilitators. MIP83c3 Subproposals enter the Monthly Governance Cycle. They must use the MIP83c3 subproposal template. MIP83c3 Subproposal Template   MIP83c3: Modify Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster state  Preamble MIP83c3-SP#: # Author(s): Contributors: Tags: template Status: Date Proposed: <yyyy-mm-dd> Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd>   Sentence Summary  Paragraph Summary  Specification  Motivation  Why are you proposing this modification to the state? If any new cluster(s) are being added through this modification, this section must reference their cluster announcements.   New state  This section contains the new complete list as it will appear in MIP83c2 if the subproposal is passed.
content.GPT-summary: MIP83 is a part of the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set that configures the Clusters of the Launch MetaDAOs. The proposal defines Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters, their state overview, and the process for modifying the state. The proposal is a required part of the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set, and it sets up the MetaDAO Clusters to begin work immediately on preparing for the Endgame Plan Launch. The post does not contain any advertising or auditing/reviewing of the proposal.

content.content: MIP83: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters This is a summary of the contents of this proposal and its impact, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  MIP83 is a part of the Endgame Plan Approval MIP Set. The proposal aims to restructure groups within the current Core Units into MetaDAOs, establishing nine MetaDAO Clusters with their codenames and MetaDAO Class. It is divided into three components that define, enumerate, and allow for the modification of this new structure:   MIP83c1 defines MetaDAO Clusters as preliminary teams led by incubating MetaDAO Facilitators that are authorized to use their resources in the Core Units to prepare proposals for onboarding to the Launch MetaDAOs.  MIP83c2 provides the initial official list of Clusters. It consists of five Creators, two Protectors and two Governors.  MIP83c3 is a process component to modify MIP83c2, allowing amendments to be made to the original proposed structure. This process component is yet to be fully fleshed out with its template and subproposal parameters.   If this proposal is ratified, it will set the parameters for the transformation of the current workforce structure. This proposal has been assigned High-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2022-09-24

content.content: The Deco Core Unit is pleased to advise that it is being considered for recognition as a CreatorDAO cluster. We are supportive of the endgame plan and look forward to bringing the Deco core product and its contributor team to the Indigo MetaDAO. Once the MIP is approved, the Deco Core Unit will offer a MetaDAO proposal for review by Maker Governance. After RFC and formal approval by Maker governance, it will be submitted to the Indigo MetaDAO for a vote on Deco Cluster Onboarding. Of course, this is contingent on the approval of the endgame MIP set. The Deco Recognized Cluster has already chosen both a qualified Indigo Facilitator and a Indigo Contributor Team Lead with the view of maintaining continuity in the management of the present Deco Contributor Team. The Deco Core unit is also assessing whether other core units and contributors may be an appropriate fit.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: RFC-DVC feedback  Is the clustering organic, or do we want to put some structure into creating the metadaos? Do current teams just pick a color? The definition of these mDAO types is missing from the MIP. It probaby needs another component explaining the protector, creator, and governor DAOs.  Things like: what roles are initially present, expected responsibilities, interaction (or not) with other metadaos, constraints on business, the definition of intangible value etc   Highly highly recommend a legal audit What levels of governance will be owned by the MetaDAOs versus Maker core? If we are still using the executive vote mechanism to pass MIPs… how do the governance systems interact? How do the budget and incentives work when metadaoes form? How do budgets change as the metadaos bootstrap? What does this look like when they are fully operational? What is the relationship between scopes and clusters?

content.content: Adding to this great list:  Does this new structure assume each MetaDAO will form an official registered entity in some jurisdiction? If so, are there preferred jurisdictions?  My assumption is that these MetaDAOs are meant to be lightweight with minimal legal ties but because this hasn’t been addressed anywhere from what I’ve seen, it probably should be clarified? Especially since Pigeon Stance still assumes RWA or DAOs may need to retain outside support, which might require legal agreements and a legal entity?

content.content: Wanted to draw attention to this to-do @rune     Sebix:  MIP83c3 is a process component to modify MIP83c2, allowing amendments to be made to the original proposed structure. This process component is yet to be fully fleshed out with its template and subproposal parameters.   The simplest way to bring this up to completeness would be to to format it as following. There are a few design decisions to make (items necessary for template, weekly vs monthly cycle eligibility, time of RFC and Frozen Period):  MIP83c3: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster Amendment Process This subproposal process overwrites the state of MIP83c2, making it possible to change the number of Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters, their names, their class, and their Cluster Facilitators. Subprosals should use this [template]. And may enter the weekly/monthly Governance cycle. MIP83c3 Subproposals are subject to the following restrictions: Request For Comments period: X Weeks Frozen Period: X Weeks

content.content: I am formally submitting this MIP (MIP83) for the October governance cycle.
We are happy to see a high quality Crimson cluster proposed and want to note we will be applying as the Indigo cluster and MetaDAO.
